channel.title: Changing client theme (new way) works with 317,508,517,525, all versions!
channel.description:
hey hey this is my new way to change your client theme
first: startup your client
second: click in the mid of the java icon (left and above on client)
third: click on "substance themes" (without the ""
fourth: chose your colour and click on it, grats now you have your new client theme

item.title: Changing client theme (new way) works with 317,508,517,525, all versions!
item.dc:creator: @brian9612 brian9612
item.description:
@brian9612 wrote:

thanks for all the nice reactions

Read full topic

item.title: Changing client theme (new way) works with 317,508,517,525, all versions!
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“Peeter, post:9, topic:360174”][quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=456611.msg3344152#msg3344152 date=1284681150]

Thanks this helped me learn about the RS2 client so much.

I can help you hide the console. (black box thingy)

It’s really hard to do, and only few people can do it.

i like to ruin jokes
nope

my hd client run

@echo off cd out start javaw -cp .;lib/hdlibs.jar -Xmx256m client 1337 live live software members english game0 exit also red x works on my hd client
[/quote]

You can add that all into the MANIFEST file in the jar, making the client runnable by simply double-clicking it on all OS’s. (No need for .bat, .cmd, .sh files)[/quote]

i do do that i just use run for developing

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:7, topic:360174”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=456611.msg3344149#msg3344149 date=1284680979]

Thanks this helped me learn about the RS2 client so much.

I can help you hide the console. (black box thingy)

It’s really hard to do, and only few people can do it.
[/quote]

i like to ruin jokes
nope

my hd client run

@echo off cd out start javaw -cp .;lib/hdlibs.jar -Xmx256m client 1337 live live software members english game0 exit also red x works on my hd client[/quote]

You can add that all into the MANIFEST file in the jar, making the client runnable by simply double-clicking it on all OS’s. (No need for .bat, .cmd, .sh files)
